meanings.definition: The dead body of an animal
meanings.sent1: The farmer buried the carcases of the cows in the field.
meanings.sent2: Vultures gathered around the carcases of the fallen deer.
meanings.sent3: The carcases of the fish were so smelly, even the cat turned away.
meanings.sent4: The carcases of the trees in winter reminded her of nature's cycle.
meanings.sent5: The scavenger birds feasted on the carcases, leaving only bones behind.

meanings.definition: The body of a human being, whether living or dead
meanings.sent1: In the horror movie, the haunted house was filled with carcases of the victims.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists discovered ancient carcases preserved in the ice.
meanings.sent3: The carcases of the zombies in the game kept coming back to life.
meanings.sent4: The carcases of the buildings in the abandoned city stood as silent witnesses.
meanings.sent5: The carcases of the shipwreck revealed the tragic fate of the sailors.
